asst-brewer.description: A non-empty string denoting the name of the assistant brewer.
asst-brewer.title: common-beer-format.recipes/asst-brewer

display-og.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the pre-fermentation gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-og.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-og

display-age-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of the aging step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-age-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-age-temp

priming-sugar-equiv.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the conversion factor to an equivalent amount of corn sugar.
priming-sugar-equiv.title: common-beer-format.recipes/priming-sugar-equiv

taste-rating.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the tasting score of the beer.
taste-rating.title: common-beer-format.recipes/taste-rating

age-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature in degrees Celsius for bottle aging.
age-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/age-temp

og.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the pre-fermentation specific gravity of the recipe.
og.title: common-beer-format.recipes/og

primary-age.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the number of days spent in primary fermentation.
primary-age.title: common-beer-format.recipes/primary-age

carbonation-used.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the carbonation measures used formatted for display in arbitrary units.
carbonation-used.title: common-beer-format.recipes/carbonation-used

display-primary-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of the primary fermentation step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-primary-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-primary-temp

age.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the number of days to bottle age the beer.
age.title: common-beer-format.recipes/age

keg-priming-factor.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the conversion factor of sugar needed to prime carbonation in large containers.
keg-priming-factor.title: common-beer-format.recipes/keg-priming-factor

origin.description: A non-empty string denoting the place of origin for a particular ingredient.
origin.title: common-beer-format.primitives/origin

caryophyllene.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent contents of caryophyllene in the hop.
caryophyllene.title: common-beer-format.hops/caryophyllene

display-time.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for an amount of time formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-time.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-time

hsi.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the Hop Stability Index, or percent decay of a hop's alpha acid over six months.
hsi.title: common-beer-format.hops/hsi

myrcene.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent contents of myrcene in the hop.
myrcene.title: common-beer-format.hops/myrcene

form.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the physical form of the hop.
Must be one of: "Pellet", "Leaf", "Plug"

- Pellet: Ground and compressed hop cones.
- Plug: Whole hop cones compressed into plugs.
- Leaf: Whole hop cones.
form.title: common-beer-format.hops/form

humulene.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent contents of humulene in the hop.
humulene.title: common-beer-format.hops/humulene

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

time.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the time in minutes the hop was added dependant on the `:use` field.

- Boil: this is the boil time.
- Mash: this is the mash time.
- First Wort: this is the boil time.
- Aroma: this is the steep time.
- Dry Hop: this is the amount of time to dry hop.
time.title: common-beer-format.hops/time

inventory.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in inventory formatted for display in arbitrary units.
inventory.title: common-beer-format.primitives/inventory

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the typical purpose of the hop's addition to a beer.
Must be one of: "Both", "Aroma", "Bittering"

- Bittering: Hops added solely for their bittering properties.
- Aroma: Hops added solely for their aromatic properties and flavor.
- Both: Hops which may be added for both/either their bittering and/or aromatic properties.
type.title: common-beer-format.hops/type

amount.description:
A value representing the amount of a particular ingredient.
When measuring weight, this is in kilograms.
When measuring volume, this is in liters.
amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount

cohumulone.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent contents of cohumulone in the hop.
cohumulone.title: common-beer-format.hops/cohumulone

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

alpha.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent contents of alpha acid in the hop.
alpha.title: common-beer-format.hops/alpha

beta.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent contents of beta acid in the hop.
beta.title: common-beer-format.hops/beta

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

display-amount.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in a recipe formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-amount

use.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the means by which the hop is added to the beer.
Must be one of: "Mash", "Boil", "Dry hop", "First wort", "Aroma"

- Aroma: Hops added to the beer after the boil. They do not significantly contribute to the bitterness of the beer.
- Boil: Hops added to the boil for bittering.
- Dry Hop: Hops added to the fermentation vessel after pitching yeast. They do not significantly contribute to the bitterness of the beer.
- First Wort: Hops added to first wort prior to the boil.
- Mash: Hops added to the mash prior to the boil.
use.title: common-beer-format.hops/use

substitutes.description: A non-empty string denoting ingredients with me bay used in place of those denoted in the record.
substitutes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/substitutes

hop.description: A record representing a hop in a beer recipe.
hop.title: common-beer-format.hops/hop

items.description: A `::hop` record wrapped in a `:hop` map.
items.title: common-beer-format.hops/hop-wrapper

display-fg.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the post-fermentation gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-fg.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-fg

display-time.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for an amount of time formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-time.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-time

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

amount-is-weight.description:
A boolean representing if the amount of the substance is measured in kilograms.
When absent, assume false and that the amount of substance is measured in liters.
amount-is-weight.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount-is-weight

use-for.description: A non-empty string denoting what the ingredient is used for.
use-for.example: Used to impart a mild, zesty flavor
use-for.title: common-beer-format.miscs/use-for

time.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the time in minutes the ingredient was added dependant on the `:use` field.
For "Boil" this is the boil time.
For "Mash" this is the mash time.
For "Primary", "Secondary", and "Bottling" this is the amount of time the ingredient spent in that state.
time.title: common-beer-format.miscs/time

inventory.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in inventory formatted for display in arbitrary units.
inventory.title: common-beer-format.primitives/inventory

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the type of the miscellaneous item added to the beer.
Must be one of: "Flavor", "Spice", "Water agent", "Fining", "Other", "Herb"

- Fining: A fining agent, such as isinglass.
- Flavor: A flavoring, such as orange peel or a flavor concentrate.
- Herb: An herb, such as mint.
- Other: Any other type of miscellaneous ingredient.
- Spice: A spice, such as cinnamon or ginger.
- Water Agent: A water agent, such as campden tablet.
type.title: common-beer-format.miscs/type

amount.description:
A value representing the amount of a particular ingredient.
When measuring weight, this is in kilograms.
When measuring volume, this is in liters.
amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

display-amount.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in a recipe formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-amount

use.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the point in the brewing cycle the miscellaneous ingredient is added to the beer.
Must be one of: "Mash", "Boil", "Bottling", "Secondary", "Primary"

- Boil: The ingredient is added to the boil.
- Mash: The ingredient is added to the mash.
- Primary: The ingredient is added to the primary fermentation.
- Secondary: The ingredient is added to the secondary fermentation.
- Bottling: The ingredient is added during the bottling process.
use.title: common-beer-format.miscs/use

misc.description: A record representing a miscellaneous ingredient in a beer recipe.
misc.title: common-beer-format.miscs/misc

items.description: A `::misc` record wrapped in a `:misc` map.
items.title: common-beer-format.miscs/misc-wrapper

est-fg.description: A non-empty string describing the calculated estimated final gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
est-fg.title: common-beer-format.recipes/est-fg

carbonation.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the carbonation for this recipe in volumes of CO2.
carbonation.title: common-beer-format.recipes/carbonation

display-tertiary-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of the tertiary fermentation step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-tertiary-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-tertiary-temp

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

tertiary-age.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the number of days spent in tertiary fermentation.
tertiary-age.title: common-beer-format.recipes/tertiary-age

ibu-method.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the method of calculation used derive the IBUs.
Must be one of: "Tinseth", "Rager", "Garetz"

- Garetz: The Garetz method of IBU calculation.
- Rager: The Rager method of IBU calculation.
- Tinseth: The Tinseth method of IBU calculation.
ibu-method.title: common-beer-format.recipes/ibu-method

og-range.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the range of original gravities formatted for display in arbitrary units.
og-range.title: common-beer-format.styles/og-range

display-fg-max.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the maximum final gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-fg-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/display-fg-max

og-min.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the minimum pre-fermentation specific gravity for the style.
og-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/og-min

display-color-min.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the minimum color formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-color-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/display-color-min

ibu-max.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the maximum bitterness in IBUs for the style.
ibu-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/ibu-max

carb-max.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the maximum carbonation for this style in volumes of CO2.
carb-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/carb-max

profile.description: A non-empty string denoting the aroma and flavor profile of the style.
profile.title: common-beer-format.styles/profile

carb-min.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the minimum carbonation for this style in volumes of CO2.
carb-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/carb-min

abv-max.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the maximum recommended ABV percentage for the style.
abv-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/abv-max

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

display-og-max.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the maximum original gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-og-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/display-og-max

style-letter.description: A non-empty string denoting the letter used to denote the style or sub-style.
style-letter.title: common-beer-format.styles/style-letter

ingredients.description: A non-empty string denoting the suggested ingredients for the style.
ingredients.title: common-beer-format.styles/ingredients

color-range.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the range of colors formatted for display in arbitrary units.
color-range.title: common-beer-format.styles/color-range

carb-range.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the range of carbonation volumes formatted for display in arbitrary units.
carb-range.title: common-beer-format.styles/carb-range

color-max.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the darkest color in SRM for the style.
color-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/color-max

category-number.description:
A non-empty string denoting the category number of this style.
The category number is a string because it can be a letter followed by a number, e.g. 'A1' on some guides.
category-number.title: common-beer-format.styles/category-number

fg-min.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the minimum post-fermentation specific gravity for the style.
fg-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/fg-min

display-color-max.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the maximum color formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-color-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/display-color-max

fg-max.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the maximum post-fermentation specific gravity for the style.
fg-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/fg-max

ibu-min.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the minimum bitterness in IBUs for the style.
ibu-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/ibu-min

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the type of beverage the style dictates.
Must be one of: "Lager", "Cider", "Mixed", "Mead", "Wheat", "Ale"

- Ale: A top-fermented beer with a fruity, hoppy taste and a dry finish.
- Cider: A fermented beverage made from fruit and water.
- Lager: A light, bottom-fermented beer with a clean, crisp taste and a smooth finish.
- Mead: A fermented beverage made from honey and water.
- Mixed: A beer style that blends two or more styles.
- Wheat: A beer made with a large proportion of wheat malt.
type.title: common-beer-format.styles/type

display-og-min.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the minimum original gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-og-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/display-og-min

display-fg-min.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the minimum final gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-fg-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/display-fg-min

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

fg-range.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the range of final gravities formatted for display in arbitrary units.
fg-range.title: common-beer-format.styles/fg-range

og-max.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the maximum pre-fermentation specific gravity for the style.
og-max.title: common-beer-format.styles/og-max

category.description: A non-empty string denoting the category this style belongs to.
category.title: common-beer-format.styles/category

ibu-range.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the range of International Bittering Units formatted for display in arbitrary units.
ibu-range.title: common-beer-format.styles/ibu-range

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

color-min.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the lightest color in SRM for the style.
color-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/color-min

examples.description: A non-empty string denoting example beers of this style.
examples.example: Every overly citrus IPA on the market.
examples.title: common-beer-format.styles/examples

abv-min.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the minimum recommended ABV percentage for the style.
abv-min.title: common-beer-format.styles/abv-min

style-guide.description: A non-empty string denoting the name of the style guide the style/category belongs to.
style-guide.title: common-beer-format.styles/style-guide

abv-range.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the range of ABV levels formatted for display in arbitrary units.
abv-range.title: common-beer-format.styles/abv-range

style.description: A record representing a beer style.
style.title: common-beer-format.styles/style

actual-efficiency.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the actual conversion efficiency between the measured final and original gravities.
actual-efficiency.title: common-beer-format.recipes/actual-efficiency

carbonation-temp.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature in degrees Celsius for either bottling or forced carbonation.
carbonation-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/carbonation-temp

priming-sugar-name.description: A non-empty string denoting the name of the priming agent used to carbonate the beer.
priming-sugar-name.title: common-beer-format.recipes/priming-sugar-name

forced-carbonation.description:
A boolean representing if this batch was force carbonated with CO2 pressure.
When absent, assume false.
forced-carbonation.title: common-beer-format.recipes/forced-carbonation

tertiary-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature in degrees Celsius for tertiary fermentation.
tertiary-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/tertiary-temp

display-carb-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of the bottling step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-carb-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-carb-temp

taste-notes.description: A non-empty string denoting any tasting notes.
taste-notes.example: A nice, full body and intense mouthfeel
taste-notes.title: common-beer-format.recipes/taste-notes

secondary-age.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the number of days spent in secondary fermentation.
secondary-age.title: common-beer-format.recipes/secondary-age

est-og.description: A non-empty string describing the calculated estimated original gravity formatted for display in arbitrary units.
est-og.title: common-beer-format.recipes/est-og

calories.description: A non-empty string describing the number of dietary calories per serving of this recipe.
calories.title: common-beer-format.recipes/calories

abv.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the actual ABV for the recipe.
abv.title: common-beer-format.recipes/abv

ibu.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the bitterness in IBUs for the recipe.
ibu.title: common-beer-format.recipes/ibu

calcium.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the amount of calcium (Ca) in parts per million.
calcium.title: common-beer-format.waters/calcium

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

sulfate.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the amount of sulfate (SO4) in parts per million.
sulfate.title: common-beer-format.waters/sulfate

chloride.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the amount of chloride (Cl-) in parts per million.
chloride.title: common-beer-format.waters/chloride

ph.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the PH of the water.
ph.title: common-beer-format.waters/ph

bicarbonate.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the amount of bicarbonate (HCO3) in parts per million.
bicarbonate.title: common-beer-format.waters/bicarbonate

amount.description:
A value representing the amount of a particular ingredient.
When measuring weight, this is in kilograms.
When measuring volume, this is in liters.
amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

magnesium.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the amount of magnesium (Mg) in parts per million.
magnesium.title: common-beer-format.waters/magnesium

sodium.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the amount of sodium (Na) in parts per million.
sodium.title: common-beer-format.waters/sodium

display-amount.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in a recipe formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-amount

water.description: A record representing the water in a beer recipe.
water.title: common-beer-format.waters/water

items.description: A `::water` record wrapped in a `:water` map.
items.title: common-beer-format.waters/water-wrapper

est-color.description: A non-empty string describing the calculated color formatted for display in arbitrary units.
est-color.title: common-beer-format.recipes/est-color

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the type of recipe.
Must be one of: "Partial mash", "All grain", "Extract"

- All Grain: A recipe that uses only malted grains.
- Partial Mash: A recipe that uses a combination of malted grains and malt extract.
- Extract: A recipe that uses only malt extract.
type.title: common-beer-format.recipes/type

boil-size.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the starting volume of the wort.
boil-size.title: common-beer-format.recipes/boil-size

fg.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the post-fermentation specific gravity of the recipe.
fg.title: common-beer-format.recipes/fg

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

display-boil-size.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the pre-boil volume formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-boil-size.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-boil-size

origin.description: A non-empty string denoting the place of origin for a particular ingredient.
origin.title: common-beer-format.primitives/origin

yield.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent rendered sugar from the fermentable.
yield.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/yield

recommend-mash.description:
A boolean representing if the fermentable is recommended to be included in the mashing step.
Only appropriate for the 'Grain' or 'Adjunct' types.
When absent, assume false.
recommend-mash.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/recommend-mash

moisture.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent moisture in the grain.
Only appropriate for the 'Grain' or 'Adjunct' types.
moisture.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/moisture

coarse-fine-diff.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent difference between the coarse grain yield and fine grain yield.
Only appropriate for the 'Grain' or 'Adjunct' types.
coarse-fine-diff.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/coarse-fine-diff

max-in-batch.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the suggested maximum percent by weight of the fermentable with respect to all fermentables.
max-in-batch.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/max-in-batch

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

diastatic-power.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the diastatic power of the grain in Lintner units.
Only appropriate for the 'Grain' or 'Adjunct' types.
diastatic-power.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/diastatic-power

add-after-boil.description:
A boolean representing if the fermentable was added after the boil.
When absent, assume false.
add-after-boil.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/add-after-boil

inventory.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in inventory formatted for display in arbitrary units.
inventory.title: common-beer-format.primitives/inventory

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the form of the fermentable.
Must be one of: "Dry extract", "Sugar", "Adjunct", "Grain", "Extract"

- Adjunct: Non-grain and non-sugar ingredients that are added to the wort that contain fermentable sugars.
- Dry Extract: Dry extract is a concentrated form of fermentable sugars derived from malted barley.
- Extract: Extract is a concentrated form of fermentable sugars derived from malted barley in liquid form.
- Grain: Whole or milled barley, rye, wheat, or other grain.
- Sugar: Raw, candied, and other natural sources of sugar (e.g. Honey) .)
type.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/type

amount.description:
A value representing the amount of a particular ingredient.
When measuring weight, this is in kilograms.
When measuring volume, this is in liters.
amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

protein.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the protein contents of the grain.
Only appropriate for the 'Grain' or 'Adjunct' types.
protein.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/protein

supplier.description: A non-empty string denoting the supplier of the fermentable ingredient.
supplier.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/supplier

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

display-color.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the color of the ingredient formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-color.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/display-color

display-amount.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in a recipe formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-amount

ibu-gal-per-lb.description:
A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the IBUs per pound per gallon of water assuming a 60 minute boil.
Only appropriate for the 'Extract' type.
ibu-gal-per-lb.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/ibu-gal-per-lb

color.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the color in Lovibond for the grain type, and SRM for all other types for the fermentable.
color.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/color

potential.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the potential yield in specific gravity units of the ingredient.
potential.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/potential

fermentable.description: A record representing a fermentable ingredient in a beer recipe.
fermentable.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/fermentable

items.description: A `::fermentable` record wrapped in a `::fermentable` map.
items.title: common-beer-format.fermentables/fermentable-wrapper

brewer.description: A non-empty string denoting the name of the brewer.
brewer.title: common-beer-format.recipes/brewer

display-tun-weight.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the empty weight of the mash tun formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-tun-weight.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-tun-weight

trub-chiller-loss.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the volume of wort lost during transition from the boiler to primary fermentation vessel.
trub-chiller-loss.title: common-beer-format.equipment/trub-chiller-loss

tun-volume.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the volume of the of the mash tun in liters.
tun-volume.title: common-beer-format.equipment/tun-volume

display-top-up-kettle.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the top-up water added to the pre-boil stage of the kettle formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-top-up-kettle.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-top-up-kettle

tun-specific-heat.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the specific heat of the mash tun in Calories per gram-degree Celsius.
tun-specific-heat.title: common-beer-format.equipment/tun-specific-heat

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

evap-rate.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percentage of wort lost to evaporation per hour of the boil.
evap-rate.title: common-beer-format.equipment/evap-rate

hop-utilization.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percentage of large batch hop utilization.
hop-utilization.title: common-beer-format.equipment/hop-utilization

display-trub-chiller-loss.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the volume of wort lost in transition between boiler and fermentation vessel formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-trub-chiller-loss.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-trub-chiller-loss

display-lauter-deadspace.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the volume of wort lost in the lauter vessel formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-lauter-deadspace.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-lauter-deadspace

boil-size.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the pre-boil volume for the equipment setup.
boil-size.title: common-beer-format.equipment/boil-size

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

display-boil-size.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the pre-boil volume formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-boil-size.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-boil-size

lauter-deadspace.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the volume of wort lost to the lauter tun.
lauter-deadspace.title: common-beer-format.equipment/lauter-deadspace

tun-weight.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the weight of the of the mash tun in kilograms.
tun-weight.title: common-beer-format.equipment/tun-weight

batch-size.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the target volume of the batch at the start of fermentation.
batch-size.title: common-beer-format.equipment/batch-size

display-batch-size.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the pre-fermentation volume formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-batch-size.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-batch-size

top-up-water.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the volume of top-up water added before fermentation in liters.
top-up-water.title: common-beer-format.equipment/top-up-water

boil-time.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the normal amount of time one boils for this equipment setup. This can be used with the evaporation rate to calculate the evaporation loss.
boil-time.title: common-beer-format.equipment/boil-time

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

calc-boil-volume.description:
A boolean denoting whether or not programs reading this equipment record should calculate the boil size.
When absent, assume false.
When true, then boil-size = `(batch-size - top-up-water - trub-chiller-loss) * (1 + boil-time * evap-rate)`
calc-boil-volume.title: common-beer-format.equipment/calc-boil-volume

display-tun-volume.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the volume capacity of the mash tun formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-tun-volume.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-tun-volume

display-top-up-water.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the volume of top-up water added before fermentation formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-top-up-water.title: common-beer-format.equipment/display-top-up-water

top-up-kettle.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the volume of top-up water added to the boil kettle before the boil begins.
top-up-kettle.title: common-beer-format.equipment/top-up-kettle

equipment.description: A record representing the brewing equipment used in brewing.
equipment.title: common-beer-format.equipment/equipment

est-abv.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the estimated ABV for the recipe.
est-abv.title: common-beer-format.recipes/est-abv

date.description:
A non-empty string denoting the display date the recipe was created on.
Intentionally implemented as a string type to match BeerXML spec.
date.title: common-beer-format.recipes/date

batch-size.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the target final volume of recipe.
batch-size.title: common-beer-format.recipes/batch-size

display-batch-size.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the pre-fermentation volume formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-batch-size.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-batch-size

secondary-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature in degrees Celsius for secondary fermentation.
secondary-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/secondary-temp

product-id.description: A non-empty string denoting the product label or id number that identifies the strain of yeast.
product-id.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/product-id

form.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the form of the yeast added to the beer.
Must be one of: "Culture", "Slant", "Dry", "Liquid"

- Liquid: A liquid slurry of yeast, usually with a source of nutrients or sugars.
- Dry: Dry yeast sold in a dehydrated state to extend shelf life.
- Slant: Yeast cultivated on a solid growth medium.
- Culture: Yeast cultivated from previous fermentations.
form.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/form

disp-min-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the minimum fermentation temperature formatted for display in arbitrary units.
disp-min-temp.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/disp-min-temp

add-to-secondary.description:
A boolean representing if this yeast was added for a secondary fermentation.
When absent, assume false.
add-to-secondary.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/add-to-secondary

max-reuse.description: A non-negative integer representing the suggested maximum number of times the yeast may be harvested and recultured.
max-reuse.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/max-reuse

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

amount-is-weight.description:
A boolean representing if the amount of the substance is measured in kilograms.
When absent, assume false and that the amount of substance is measured in liters.
amount-is-weight.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount-is-weight

culture-date.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the date the yeast sample was last cultured formatted for display in arbitrary structure.
culture-date.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/culture-date

flocculation.description:
A case-sensitive string representing how dense of a floc the yeast will form.
Must be one of: "Medium", "Very high", "High", "Low"

- Low: The yeast settles out of suspension slowly.
- Medium: The yeast settles out of suspension at a moderate rate.
- High: The yeast settles out of suspension quickly.
- Very High: The yeast settles out of suspension very quickly.
flocculation.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/flocculation

min-temperature.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the minimum recommended temperature of fermentation.
min-temperature.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/min-temperature

laboratory.description: A non-empty string denoting the laboratory that cultivated the yeast.
laboratory.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/laboratory

inventory.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in inventory formatted for display in arbitrary units.
inventory.title: common-beer-format.primitives/inventory

disp-max-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the maximum fermentation temperature formatted for display in arbitrary units.
disp-max-temp.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/disp-max-temp

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the type of yeast added to the beer.
Must be one of: "Lager", "Wheat", "Ale", "Champagne", "Wine"

- Ale: Yeast that ferments at higher temperatures and produces a more fruity, estery, and alcohol-forward beer.
- Lager: Yeast that ferments at lower temperatures and produces a crisp, clean, and alcohol-restrained beer.
- Wheat: Yeast that ferments at higher temperatures and produces a fruity and phenol-forward beer.
- Wine: Yeast traditionally used in wine making.
- Champagne: Yeast traditionally used in champagne making, offering a dry taste.
type.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/type

amount.description:
A value representing the amount of a particular ingredient.
When measuring weight, this is in kilograms.
When measuring volume, this is in liters.
amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/amount

times-cultured.description:
A non-negative integer representing the number of times this yeast has been harvested and re-used.
A value of zero assumes the yeast came directly from the manufacturer.
times-cultured.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/times-cultured

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

best-for.description: A non-empty string denoting the styles of beer this yeast is best suited for.
best-for.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/best-for

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

max-temperature.description: An IEEE-754 floating point number representing the maximum recommended temperature of fermentation.
max-temperature.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/max-temperature

display-amount.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the amount of the ingredient in a recipe formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-amount.title: common-beer-format.primitives/display-amount

attenuation.description: A positive IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent of malt sugar that can be converted to ethanol and carbon dioxide.
attenuation.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/attenuation

yeast.description: A record representing the yeast in a beer recipe.
yeast.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/yeast

items.description: A `::yeast` record wrapped in a `:yeast` map.
items.title: common-beer-format.yeasts/yeast-wrapper

boil-time.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the time in minutes to boil the wort.
boil-time.title: common-beer-format.recipes/boil-time

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

efficiency.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the percent brewhouse efficiency to be used for estimating the starting gravity of the beer.
efficiency.title: common-beer-format.recipes/efficiency

display-tun-weight.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for mash tun weight formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-tun-weight.title: common-beer-format.mash/display-tun-weight

sparge-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature of the sparge in degrees Celsius.
sparge-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/sparge-temp

display-grain-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for grain temperature formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-grain-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/display-grain-temp

equip-adjust.description:
A boolean denoting whether or not programs should account for the temperature effects of the equipment used.
When absent, assume false.
equip-adjust.title: common-beer-format.mash/equip-adjust

tun-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature of the grain tun in degrees Celsius.
tun-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/tun-temp

grain-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature of the grain before adding it to the mash in degrees Celsius.
grain-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/grain-temp

tun-specific-heat.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the specific heat of the mash tun in Calories per gram-degree Celsius.
tun-specific-heat.title: common-beer-format.mash/tun-specific-heat

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

infuse-amount.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the volume of water in liters required for an infusion step.
infuse-amount.title: common-beer-format.mash/infuse-amount

display-infuse-amt.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the volume of infused liquid formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-infuse-amt.title: common-beer-format.mash/display-infuse-amt

step-time.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the time in minutes to spend at this step.
step-time.title: common-beer-format.mash/step-time

infuse-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of an infusion step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
infuse-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/infuse-temp

display-step-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of an arbitrary step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-step-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/display-step-temp

end-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature of the mash after the step has completed in degrees Celsius.
end-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/end-temp

name.description: A non-empty string representing the name of the ingredient.
name.title: common-beer-format.primitives/name

ramp-time.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the time in minutes to achieve the desired step temperature.
ramp-time.title: common-beer-format.mash/ramp-time

type.description:
A case-sensitive string representing the type of mash step.
Must be one of: "Decoction", "Temperature", "Infusion"

- Decoction: A mash step where the fermentable ingredients are boiled and then returned to the mash tun.
- Infusion: A mash step where fermentable ingredients steep in water at a specific temperature.
- Temperature: A mash step where the temperature of the mash is held at a specific temperature for a specific time by an external source.
type.title: common-beer-format.mash/type

water-grain-ratio.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the water:grain ratio after infusion formatted for display in arbitrary units.
water-grain-ratio.title: common-beer-format.mash/water-grain-ratio

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

decoction-amt.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the calculated volume of mash to decoct formatted for display in arbitrary units.
decoction-amt.title: common-beer-format.mash/decoction-amt

step-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature of the mash step should be performed at in degrees Celsius.
step-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/step-temp

description.description: A non-empty string describing the mash step.
description.example: Stir your grain bag carefully at 140F.
description.title: common-beer-format.mash/description

mash-step.description: A record representing a step within the mashing process.
mash-step.title: common-beer-format.mash/mash-step

items.description: A `::mash` record wrapped in a `:mash` map
items.title: common-beer-format.mash/mash-step-wrapper

display-sparge-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for sparging process temperature formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-sparge-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/display-sparge-temp

ph.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the PH of the water.
ph.title: common-beer-format.mash/ph

version.description: An integer representing the version of the BeerXML standard implemented in a given record. Currently, only 1 exists.
version.title: common-beer-format.primitives/version

tun-weight.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the weight of the of the mash tun in kilograms.
tun-weight.title: common-beer-format.mash/tun-weight

notes.description: A non-empty string representing any notes about the subject.
notes.title: common-beer-format.primitives/notes

display-tun-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for mash tun temperature formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-tun-temp.title: common-beer-format.mash/display-tun-temp

mash.description: A record representing the mashing process.
mash.title: common-beer-format.mash/mash

display-secondary-temp.description: A non-empty string denoting a display value for the temperature of the secondary fermentation step formatted for display in arbitrary units.
display-secondary-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/display-secondary-temp

primary-temp.description: A non-negative IEEE-754 floating point number representing the temperature in degrees Celsius for primary fermentation.
primary-temp.title: common-beer-format.recipes/primary-temp

fermentation-stages.description: An integer representing the number of fermentation stages in the recipe.
fermentation-stages.title: common-beer-format.recipes/fermentation-stages

recipe.description: A record representing a beer recipe.
recipe.title: common-beer-format.recipes/recipe

items.description: A `::recipe` record wrapped in a `:recipes` map.
items.title: common-beer-format.recipes/recipe-wrapper
